creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell in memory of James S. and Sallie M. Bell
description: arm chair, Chippendale style; solid urn-shaped splat supports boldly curved crest rail with carved shell ornament in center; arms curve outward and terminate in broad volutes; shells ornament the knees of the cabriole legs that terminate in claw and ball feet; slip seat upholstered in crimson damask; Philadelphia type, possibly made by Savery
medium: Walnut and white pine with modern upholstery
title: Armchair
